required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase 1 Study of SHR-A1811 in Patients With Selected HER2 Expressing Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, and Antitumour Activity of SHR-A1811, in Patients With HER2-expressing Advanced Gastric or Gastroesophageal Junction Adenocarcinoma and Colorectal Cancer: a Phase 1 Study

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single arm, open-label, dose escalation, PK expansion and efficacy expansion study of phase I. The purpose of this study is to assess the tolerability, safety, pharmacokinetics and immunogenicity of SHR-A1811 and preliminary anti-tumor efficacy in HER2-expressing advanced gastric or gastroesophageal junction adenocarcinoma and colorectal cancer.

primary_outcome.measure: DLT and the recommended Phase 2 dose (RP2D)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Subjects will be treated and observed for dose-limiting toxicity(DLT) through the end of the first cycle (Days 1-21).

intervention.description: There are six pre-defined dose regimens . Subjects will be enrolled with an initial dose

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Has a pathologically or cytologically documented advanced/unresectable or metastatic gastric or gastroesophageal junction adenocarcinoma and colorectal cancer that is refractory to or intolerable with standard treatment, or for which no standard treatment is available.
- At least one evaluable or measurable lesion should be present and identified according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors(RECIST) version 1.1.
- Has an ECOG PS 0-1.
- Has a life expectancy of ≥ 3 months.
- Has adequate organ function
Exclusion Criteria:
- Has unresolved toxicities from previous anticancer therapy, defined as toxicities not yet resolved to NCI-CTCAE version 5.0 grade ≤ 1.
- Has received HER2 antibody drug conjugates,.
- Central nervous system metastasis or meningeal metastasis with clinical symptoms
- Has active infection requiring systemic treatment.
